name: increased explosion
desc: Increased explosion radius and damage.

name: Scrappin
desc: Due to their love for battle, orks will begin fighting even harder as their ship takes damage.

name: Degraded Targeting Core
desc:
Salvaged from the corpse of a paragon, this targeting core has lost it's peak abilities, but is nonetheless very powerful.

Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Precludes the installation of a Dedicated Targeting Core or an Integrated Targeting Unit.

name: Bultach Construction
desc: Made by the Bultach Coalition to last many battles, their ships are exceptionally easy to recover even after being destroyed in combat.
short: Ship almost always recoverable if lost.

name: Low Maintenance
desc: Decreases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s.

name: Shockwave Negating Armor
desc: An expensive, thorough upgrade to the ship's armor in order to let it better resist explosions or impacts of particularly massive size. Singular impacts dealing above 4000 damage will be negated by 70 percent. Often used when facing targets using doomsday weapons, as it offers no other benefits whatsoever.
short: Decreases single-hit damage above 4000 by 70 percent.

name: Extensive Missile Racks
desc: Due to this salvage sporeship's vast hull, a massive amount of missiles can be stored. Increases the ammo capacity of missile weapons by %s.

name: Massive Vessel
desc: An expensive, thorough upgrade to the ship's armor in order to let it better resist explosions or impacts of particularly massive size. Often used when facing targets using doomsday weapons, as it offers no other benefits whatsoever. Reduces damage above a threshold of 4500 by 70 percent.
short: Decreases single-hit damage above 4000 by 70 percent.

name: EMP Resistant Plating
desc: Decreases the amount of damage taken from EMP weapons (such as Ion Cannons) by %s.

name: Semi-automated Ship
desc:
This ship is semi-automated, only capable of taking on a small crew for maintenance and safety purposes.

Semi-automated ships require specialized equipment and expertise to maintain, resulting in a maximum combat readiness penalty of %s.

name: Linked Hull
desc: Mirrors certain aspects between the parent and child hulls.

name: HULLMOD CONFLICT
desc: %s, the hullmod you tried to install conflicts with this hull or another previously installed hullmod.
short: %s, the hullmod you tried to install conflicts with this hull or another previously installed hullmod.

name: Cramped Flight Deck
desc: The flight decks on this ship are exceptionally cramped due to the size of the vessel. Causes interfere with normal operation. Time to launch replacement fighters is increased by %s.

name: Linked Hull TWO
desc: Mirrors certain aspects between the parent and child hulls.

name: Linked Hull THREE
desc: Mirrors certain aspects between the parent and child hulls.

name: Nadhm√≤r Ballistic Suite
desc:
The streamlined ballistic suite of the Nadhmor effortlessly integrates most ballistics quite well. However, the advanced hardware possesses a mere hint of modularity, and the wing hardpoints will accept missile weapons, with some fuss from the flux grid.

The following only applies to weapons in %s mounts.

%s Weapons:
The total spent ordinance points (%s) multiplied by 8 and added to flux dissipation.
Total dissipation: %s

name: Sathar Weapon Swapper
desc: Allows you to change weapons on the Sathar.
short: Variable weapon selection. You shouldn't see this in-game.

name: Furaidh Siege Laser
desc: Installs an incredibly powerful energy blaster as the main armament. Removing this hullmod swaps the weapon to the next.

name: Chaneilgin Artillery
desc: Installs a long range artillery cannon as the main armament. Removing this hullmod swaps the weapons to the next.

name: Tonnas Motha Torpedo
desc: Installs a massive strike torpedo as the main armament. Removing this hullmod swaps the weapon to the next.
